Yesterday, I ran the 10K at the Montevideo Marathon without much sleep as the night before I was sharing a friend's oneâ€¦
data.text:
What to do when thereâ€™s room to grow The beginning of a new year feels like there is new wave of possibilities. Whether you have specific New Yearâ€™s resolutions, or you simply want to make healthier choices in your daily life, now is the time to start Once youâ€™ve identified an area in your life where you could be doing a little better, youâ€™re halfway there. Admitting the need for change isnâ€™t always easy, and you should feel proud for having the courage to be real with yourself. At the same time, donâ€™t feel pressured to put yourself in a box. There are tons of different ways to achieve a goalâ€”the important part is being intentional about setting that goal. For example, if your aim is to lose 10 pounds, thereâ€™s an incredibly wide range of activities you could pursue thatâ€™ll help you on your journey. Think everything from walking, lifting weights or a planking challenge. - Learn a new skill Make an addition to your life that sparks curiosity and expands your potential. Thereâ€™s no shortage of workshops in very diverse range of hobbies. And additional a great way to practise the new language and make friends. - Pick up a new or old sport What did you do as a child? Did you like ballet? Why not pick up a ballet class. It challenges your mind and a great workout. Go for a daily walk in your local park, during lunch or after work. Discover the area where your life. Whatever you do, you are in charge. Need help to take the first step die to lack of confidence, book a taster session! #expatchallenge #expatonthemove #expatroots #expatlife #Expatsupportâ € #teamwork #Globallymobile #Expatexplore #thrivingabroad #belonging â € #Globalcitizen #citizenoftheworld #globalmobility #expatlifestyle #womensupportingwomen #expats #expatliving #expatsinthenetherlands #expatsinamsterdam #makingmemories #newchapter #discovering #expatonthemove #dutchlife #dutchlifestyle #expatlife #utrechtexpats #utrechthotspot #livingabroad #worklifebalance

Whether you have specific New Yearâ€™s resolutions, or you simply want to make healthier choices in your daily life, now is the time to start Once youâ€™ve identified an area in your life where you could be doing a little better, youâ€™re halfway there. Admitting the need for change isnâ€™t always easy, and you should feel proud for having the courage to be real with yourself. At the same time, donâ€™t feel pressured to put yourself in a box. There are tons of different ways to achieve a goalâ€”the important part is being intentional about setting that goal. For example, if your aim is to lose 10 pounds, thereâ€™s an incredibly wide range of activities you could pursue thatâ€™ll help you on your journey. ğŸŒŠBalancing work and life is essential, but it's not always easyâ›µï¸ That's why I believe in the power of incorporating fun activities into our personal lives. Recently, I had the pleasure of joining Tyler Moak, Nilanjan Mukherjee, MBA, and Michael Crowley, from Bio-Rad, BioPharma West region for an unforgettable sailing adventure. ğŸ‘¥ One of the most beautiful aspects of our sailing trip was the way it brought us together as a team. Sailing isn't just about navigating the waters; it's about working together, communicating effectively, and trusting each other. These are the same qualities we value at our company, and experiencing them firsthand outside of the office only reinforces their importance. ğŸŒŸ Our sailing adventure wasn't just about relaxation and enjoyment (although there was plenty of that!). It was also about fostering stronger bonds and promoting team chemistry. These are invaluable assets in any professional setting, and I'm grateful for the opportunity to strengthen them with such an amazing group of colleagues. ğŸ¥ Check out the highlight video of our sailing trip below! Get ready to see teamwork, camaraderie, and a whole lot of fun in action ğŸ¤ª. Here's to finding the perfect balance between work and play! https://lnkd.in/gJe8B8xk #TeamBuilding #SailingAdventure #WorkLifeBalance

ğ’ğ­ğ¨ğ«ğ² ğŸ’ ğ¨ğŸ ğŸ“ğŸ /// ğˆğ­ ğŸğğğ¥ğ¬ ğšğ¬ ğ¢ğŸ ğ¨ğ®ğ« ğ¬ğšğœğ«ğ¢ğŸğ¢ğœğğ¬ ğ ğ¨ ğ®ğ§ğ§ğ¨ğ­ğ¢ğœğğ Matteoâ€™s dadâ€™s team has won the F1 driversâ€™ championship this year. He looks so happy seeing his dad with the rest of the crew celebrating on tv. Look at him smile. And knowing that his dad will be home next week, he couldnâ€™t be happier. But when should I tell him about next season? That the F1 calendar will feature a record 23 races across a period of just over eight months. There will be double and triple-headers which means marathon travel for team staff. His dad will be away for weeks, perhaps even months in a row. How should I answer Matteoâ€™s difficult questions this time: â€œğ¼ğ‘  ğ‘šğ‘¦ ğ‘‘ğ‘ğ‘‘ ğ‘ ğ‘ğ‘“ğ‘’? ğ‘Šâ„ğ‘’ğ‘› ğ‘–ğ‘  â„ğ‘’ ğ‘ğ‘œğ‘šğ‘–ğ‘›ğ‘” â„ğ‘œğ‘šğ‘’? ğ‘Šâ„ğ‘’ğ‘Ÿğ‘’ ğ‘–ğ‘  â„ğ‘’ ğ‘›ğ‘œğ‘¤? ğ‘Šğ‘–ğ‘™ğ‘™ â„ğ‘’ ğ‘ğ‘’ â„ğ‘œğ‘šğ‘’ ğ‘“ğ‘œğ‘Ÿ ğ‘šğ‘¦ ğ‘ğ‘–ğ‘Ÿğ‘¡â„ğ‘‘ğ‘ğ‘¦? ğ‘Šâ„ğ‘¦ ğ‘‘ğ‘œğ‘’ğ‘  â„ğ‘–ğ‘  ğ‘¡ğ‘’ğ‘ğ‘š ğ‘ğ‘ ğ‘˜ â„ğ‘–ğ‘š ğ‘¡ğ‘œ ğ‘¡ğ‘Ÿğ‘ğ‘£ğ‘’ğ‘™ ğ‘ ğ‘œ ğ‘šğ‘¢ğ‘â„? ğ¶ğ‘ğ‘›â€™ğ‘¡ ğ‘¡â„ğ‘’ğ‘¦ ğ‘ ğ‘’ğ‘›ğ‘‘ ğ‘ ğ‘œğ‘šğ‘’ğ‘ğ‘œğ‘‘ğ‘¦ ğ‘’ğ‘™ğ‘ ğ‘’?â€ How should I respond when he is scared or feels alone: â€œğ‘Šâ„ğ‘ğ‘¡ ğ‘¤ğ‘–ğ‘™ğ‘™ ğ‘¦ğ‘œğ‘¢ ğ‘‘ğ‘œ ğ‘¤â„ğ‘’ğ‘› ğ‘ ğ‘œğ‘šğ‘’ğ‘œğ‘›ğ‘’ ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ‘’ğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘  ğ‘–ğ‘›ğ‘¡ğ‘œ ğ‘œğ‘¢ğ‘Ÿ â„ğ‘œğ‘¢ğ‘ ğ‘’ ğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘‘ ğ‘‘ğ‘ğ‘‘ ğ‘–ğ‘  ğ‘›ğ‘œğ‘¡ â„ğ‘’ğ‘Ÿğ‘’? ğ¼ ğ‘“ğ‘’ğ‘’ğ‘™ ğ‘ ğ‘ğ‘‘, ğ‘–ğ‘¡â€™ğ‘  ğ‘ ğ‘™ğ‘œğ‘¡ â„ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ‘‘ğ‘’ğ‘Ÿ ğ‘“ğ‘œğ‘Ÿ ğ‘šğ‘’ ğ‘¤â„ğ‘’ğ‘› ğ‘‘ğ‘ğ‘‘â€˜ğ‘  ğ‘›ğ‘œğ‘¡ â„ğ‘’ğ‘Ÿğ‘’. ğ¼ ğ‘šğ‘–ğ‘ ğ‘  â„ğ‘–ğ‘š ğ‘’ğ‘£ğ‘’ğ‘Ÿğ‘¦ ğ‘‘ğ‘ğ‘¦â€¦â€ How many times will I allow myself to tell a little white lie next season while in reality there are oceans between them? â€œDad is working late the next couple of weeks and he has to start early every day, so you wonâ€™t see him.â€ Does the organization even realize what impact this schedule has on the team crew and their families involved? It feels as if our sacrifices go unnoticed. _ _ _ ğŸŒ Expat Valley is the global expert on successful international family relocations. Contact us today to ensure your family relocation experience is worry-free and empowering! ğŸ‘¨ğŸ‘©ğŸ‘§ğŸ‘¦ğŸ“¦âœˆï¸ğŸ¡â¤ï¸ #GlobalMobility #FamilyRelocation #ExpatLife

Make your challenges exciting and unique! My friend and coach Julio "Runner" Molina is off to run the marathon of RÃ­o Boedo, at Bascones de Ojeda in northern Spain this Sunday. What makes this race particularly unique is that the village is home to 178 inhabitants and the local mare is the village doctor - who is passionate about running. This race attracts many die-hards from the various corners of Spain. Julio will be travelling 600 km with 3 other friends for this event. As the village doesnâ€™t have a local gym or large building, the locals will offer their houses so the participants (around 60) can shower after the race. Furthermore, the villagers will manage the water stations and be involved in the whole event! You donâ€™t have to aim to run Boston, NY or London right? Even a small and unassuming location can be the perfect setting for your challenge. What is worth remembering is that we need to set these challenges and goals to keep our focus and to support our own fitness and lifestyle. This location is on my list of â€œmust run for 2024â€ Do you have an event planed? _________________________________________________________________________________ Hi! I'm Hec. I'm on a mission to enable every guy in his forties and beyond, to live a healthy and fit life by developing great habits. Itâ€™s about following the science and developing the best strategies. ğŸ’¥ Follow and Ring the Bell ğŸ”” ğŸ‘‰ Hec Salgado #hecsalgado #fitness #longevity #wellbeing #mindset #goals

What a challengeğŸ’™ #Nordea mOWLtion Challenge Spring 24 - walking has finished already. I spent around 80 hours walking - reaching 385 kilometres within two months, finally on 15th place. Is it a good or bad results? Should I be proud? I am #proudğŸ’™ Not only for myself but also for those who actively support my goal: ğŸ«¶Agata Dudziak thank you for remote walking together - seems there is no any obstacles for those who really want support others ğŸ«¶Beata Bogdan-PierzchaÅ‚a thank you for walking together onsite and reaching the last kilometres My ğŸ¥‡goes to Agnieszka Grubczak who is leading #ActiveNordeaCommunity and is responsible for making this challenge happen. In all difficult moments I thought about your smile, optimism, enthusiasm and unlimited trustğŸ«¶ Was it #easy to get this result - NOT - not for me who is a #reader rather than #walker. Was it #worth to do it - definitely YES - I am full of #proudness, #happiness, #positivevibes. Do I love walking - NO Do I care my health - YES Do I enjoy #togetherness -YES It is awesome to do what we love, but sometimes it is worth to do what we need. Maybe we love it, maybe not. But it will be doneğŸ€ The funny thing was how I moved my goal - firstly want to be in 40, then in 20, finally fighting of 15th place up to the last minute. And, what a surprise, it wasnt a competition with others. I competed mostly with myself - my laziness, other passions, easier tasks. In this context I wonğŸ’™ Thank you those who supportğŸ’™ #challenge #competition #collaboration #support

My Cycling Adventure in Italy: A Journey of Connection and Learning What Happened: ğŸ›£ï¸ Embarked on a 750 km cycling adventure through Italy. ğŸš´ Met a diverse group of cyclists Elizaveta Demyanenko and few others during one of the legs of my journey. How These People Helped: ğŸ¤ Sense of Belonging: The group welcomed me warmly, making me feel like part of their community. ğŸ—³ï¸ Democratic Decision-Making: Ensured all voices were heard and agreed on common actions without imposing decisions. ğŸŒ Local Guidance: Helped me understand local customs and traditions. ğŸ« Practical Assistance: Assisted in booking tickets, navigating travel hassles, and finding the best travel options. ğŸŒŸ Supportive Environment: Offered continuous support and encouragement throughout the journey. Where We Met: ğŸï¸ Encountered the group during a cycling rest stop in a small Italian village. Learnings: ğŸŒ Cultural Understanding: Importance of connecting with people to understand and respect their culture. â¤ï¸ Empathy and Collaboration: Learned how empathy and mutual respect can lead to effective teamwork. ğŸŒŸ Networking Beyond Business: Realized that true networking is about forming genuine human connections. ğŸŒ Adapting to New Environments: Emphasized the need to adapt and integrate into new cultural settings. ğŸ«‚ Community Spirit: Experienced the power of community and collective support. Looking forward to more such enriching encounters during my stay in Europe. #Networking #CulturalExchange #CyclingAdventure #TravelDiaries #Leadership #Empathy #Teamwork #TravelWithMe #LearningJourney #Collaboration #EuropeTrip

ğŸ‘‰ This one was a hard one too post ğŸƒâ™‚ï¸ I ran a marathon as a bet ğŸ’¸ ğŸ’¸ ğŸ’¸ â—¾ I've been taking a lot away from other people on LinkedIn sharing their personal experiences and so here is my attempt. â—¾ A few years ago, after returning from a holiday to Thailand, I made a bet with my sister in-law that I could run a marathon without any training. â—¾ I'd heard that if the Human body was in a life or death situation that it could run over 200km.... So for me 42.2km would be physically possible. That was my logic, and I didn't even fact check the information. With no preparation I was able to finish and this is what I learnt: ğŸ‘‰ We are capable of more than we think - We place mental barriers in front of ourselves and wait for someone else to do it first to let us know it's possible. I'd previously only ever ran 5km, but I was able to shift this mindset from a hearing one statement "were capable of over 200km's". ğŸ‘‰ You don't need all the expensive tools, tech or gear - I was running in $10 trainers from Bali. There's so much new tech out there, that we are becoming dependent on the next big thing. Solutions don't always need to rely on sophisticated and expensive hardware. ğŸ‘‰ Create small goals and don't be overwhelmed by the big picture - I first got cramp in my legs around the 18km mark and with 24.2km remaining I would cramp every couple of km's. So I focused on the checkpoint flags and getting my body to the next one rather than the finish line. Set small targets to achieve the big picture. ğŸ‘‰ It's rare to be 100% prepared and know all the answers - The night before the race I'd ate McDonalds for dinner and then threw down some Starburst the morning of the race. There were a lot of other people with gel packs and better preparation. But I was still able to complete the race. You might not always know the answers in the workplace or be 100% prepared going into a meeting or interview. But chances are you will get through it and have a lot more in you than you think. #work #marathon #fitness #threatintelligence #simplycybercommunitychallenge #perthwa #running

LAUGHTER, the best medicine when facing through tough challenges (and mud!) ğŸ˜‚ Laughter is not just a great companion but essential support for both challenging ultra marathons and the demanding business race. Last weekend I embarked on my last ultra marathon for 2023 - 33 miles and 8,500 feet of elevation in 8 hours from Prestatyn beach to the summit of the Welsh mountain Cyrn y Brain, along the very undulating Offaâ€™s Dyke ancient path. As the photo shows, there was plenty of mud along the route. ğŸ¤£ As I ploughed through ankle deep mud, I just laughed at myself, thinking â€œsurely this is not how to spend a Sunday ?â€ ğŸ¤” Laughter helps me through tough challenges and build a positive can-do attitude. Just as ultra marathons challenge our physical and mental stamina, the business world challenges our professional mettle. Businesses that embrace laughter create an environment where challenges are viewed as opportunities, and hurdles are a chance to thrive. Laughter acts as our 'mental hydration station'. It refreshes our mindset, toughening our resolve and helps us bounce back stronger after a setback. Using the marathon metaphor to its limits (sorry ğŸ˜‚), humour opens up our stride, paving the way for creative breakthroughs. In the race against market demands, a positive mindset, fuelled by laughter propels us forward, leaving competitors in the dust (or stuck in the mud !). How do you use laughter to help you ? Co-authored with Emily Middleton, Intern with Strategic Risk & Compliance Consultancy (SRC). #laughterisgoodforthesoul #positivementalattitude #ultramarathon
